text: IOWA (, ), is a Belarusian-Russian pop music group (trio).Группа IOWA везет в Юрмалу белорусский мед, клюкву и детские снимки == History == IOWA is named after the album Iowa by the band Slipknot. In 2008, vocalist Ekaterina Ivanchikova sang in the musical The Prophet by Ilya Oleynikov.TVNET. Made in LV — На «Новой волне» победила Niloo из России. IOWA was formed in 2009 in Mahilyow. In 2010, after a series of concerts in St. Petersburg, the group decided to move to St. Petersburg, Russia where the band members live today. The band's producer is Oleg Baranov. ==Discography== *2014 — Export *2016 — Import == Awards and nominations == ;2012 *New Wave: audience choice (won) ;2013 * RU.TV Award: Best start of the year (nom) Объявлены номинанты Русской Музыкальной премии телеканала RU.TV 2013 ; 2015 * Muz-TV Award: Best Song, Breakthrough (nom)Объявлены номинанты «Премии МУЗ-ТВ 2015. Гравитация» * RU.TV Award: Dolce Vita (nom)Объявлены номинанты Русской Музыкальной премии телеканала RU.TV — 2015 * Golden Gramophone Award (won) * Russian National Music Award: Best Song (nom), Best Pop Group (nom) ;2016 * Muz-TV Award: Best Pop Band (nom) * Russian National Music Award: Best Song (nom), Best Pop Group (nom) ;2017 * Muz-TV Award: Best Pop Band (nom) * Russian National Music Award: Best Pop Group (won) ;2018 * Muz-TV Award: Best Pop Band (nom) * Russian National Music Award: Best Pop Group (nom) === 2019 === * Russian National Music Award: Best Pop Group (nom) ==References== ==External links== * Official site * Iowa on Yandex.
